definition: state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: XuanZu pretends to zen to light the sea king, to test the courtiers faithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖假装要禅位给光海君，以此试探臣子们的忠心。

sentences.english: You say, which emperor won't like this kind of official?
sentences.chinese: 你说哪个皇上不喜欢这样的臣子啊？

sentences.english: The opinion book from the vassal to a lord.
sentences.chinese: 臣子向帝王呈递的意见书。

sentences.english: The king and his advisers were in their places, opposite the two doors. All was ready.
sentences.chinese: 国王和他的臣子站在两扇门对面，已经就位。

sentences.english: But the king's officials were not willing to raise a hand to strike the priests of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 扫罗的臣子却不肯伸手杀耶和华的祭司。

definition: the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
